page.title: 01Survey Area,Mark Cross,Frant
page.content: The area lies between Eridge,Frant and Mark Cross. The highest point is Saxonbury Hill and that is 203 metres high. Most of the area is fields with quite a few small copses and woods. It is gently rolling farmland with fields divided by hedges. There are no villages only farms and private houses,many tile hung in the traditional Sussex style.Most of the farms are sheep or dairy farms with one or two large arable farms.The woodland is all deciduous woodland where some coppicing is carried out. There is a lot of wild life in the area including deer,pheasants, plenty of rabbits,foxes and badgers.There are also some caves in Eridge Old Park.The caves are quite dark inside and were once used for hanging meat.There are also many pleasant country walks to enjoy.
